oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Paul Overstreet Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Paul Overstreet (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Paul Overstreet; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie finds his thoughts and describes the structure of the show to Paul Overstreet -- (00:28) Overstreet recalls reading about Abraham and Lot in the Bible, and Overstreet correlates the story to removing himself from arguing over money -- (02:12) Overstreet recalls his decision causing his contract to be suspended by Stretch Productions and MTM Records -- (03:21) Collie describes Overstreet as a 'hot' songwriter while Overstreet humbles himself; Overstreet talks about getting married and the influences of Mac Davis, Kris Kristofferson, Dolly Parton, Willie Nelson and Dennis Morgan -- (05:25) Collie invites Overstreet to give short descriptions to his reactions to songs Collie lists -- (05:44) Collie lists "You're Still New to Me" and Overstreet can only think of Paul Davis and Marie Osmond -- (05:54) Collie lists "One Love at a Time," and Overstreet thinks of writing with Davis -- (06:19) Collie lists "I Won't Take Less Than Your Love," and Overstreet says that it was played for him in church -- (07:21) Collie lists "Forever and Ever, Amen," and Overstreet and Collie discuss the success of the song that came from a night with Don Schlitz -- (08:07) Collie lists "When You Say Nothing at All," and Overstreet calls it a sad story -- (08:29) Collie lists "Houston Solution," and Overstreet recalls getting asked to write an answer to "Houston Solution" for a female vocalist -- (09:10) Collie lists "Love Speaks Louder Than Words," and Overstreet reveals Marie Osmond recorded the song -- (09:38) Collie introduces his next group of subjects for Overstreet -- (10:11) Collie asks Overstreet about some interesting characters, and Overstreet lists his family members -- (10:43) Collie questions what would be a defining experience for Overstreet, and Overstreet says it was when Nash Overstreet was born of a C-section -- (13:17) Overstreet recalls "Love Helped Those" playing when Chord Overstreet was born -- (13:53) Collie has Overstreet remember a time where Buck Owens had been doing an interview, and Overstreet was caught off-guard by the fact he was in the wrong interview -- (16:18) Collie has Overstreet remember an unforgettable gift; Overstreet recalls getting a board that said "Paul is A-OK in PA" -- (17:35) Overstreet laughs about a dream he had, about Overstreet being unfaithful to his wife, that he and Schlitz turned into a song -- (20:38) Overstreet calls "Love Helps Those" his most unforgettable record because it came on the heels of him not being able to record for a year -- (21:34) Collie has Overstreet reflect on how he can be too concentrated on music, and Overstreet declares how he wants to be a good father -- (22:39) Overstreet discusses how Nash Overstreet likes Cowboys and Indians -- (23:45) Summer Overstreet is described to be a 'singing girl' -- (24:02) Collie and Overstreet joke about how its special that Chord Overstreet and the other children get to be involved in music videos -- (24:40) Collie reflects on how he would tell people that they only reason he would not be around was for his children
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Overstreet, Paul; Collie, Biff;
